definition: earnestly and sincerely (idiom); with all sincerity
sincere/authentic/really/truly
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
sincere/authentic/really/truly
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: He has a sincere desire to help you.
sentences.chinese: 他是誠心誠意地想幫助你。

sentences.english: Bring my sincere, send me "into the word" blessing.
sentences.chinese: 帶上我的誠心誠意，送上我“成字”的祝福。

sentences.english: But some politicians must be sincere about being fiscally responsible.
sentences.chinese: 一些政客必須誠心誠意的對財政政策負責。

sentences.english: He was in earnest: in love, really.
sentences.chinese: 而他卻是誠心誠意的愛上了，真的。

definition: sincerity
to try one's utmost/to strive
to advise
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten
to console/to soothe/relieved
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to whine/to be grouchy
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
loved by all/to have universal appeal
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
